data.description: Techniques for quantitative analysis of algorithms. Charging arguments, amortization, probabilistic methods. Adversary and information lower bounds. Use of methods from combinatorics, complex analysis, and asymptotics in obtaining precise analyses of quicksort, chained hashing, and other algorithms.  Students are strongly encouraged to have knowledge of algorithms (e.g.,COMP SCI 577) or applied math analysis (e.g.,MATH 321) and theory of probability (e.g.,MATH/​STAT  431).
data.title: MATHEMATICAL TECHNIQUES IN THE ANALYSIS OF ALGORITHMS
